Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Initial Appearance as to Adalberto Ortiz-Diaz (4) was held on 6/6/2012. Prior to the hearing, the govt contacted the court by telephone and requested that the indictment be unsealed as to all defts. The court granted the govt's motion to unseal. Defendant was provided with a copy of the Indictment, was advised of the charges and as to his rights. After reviewing the CJA-23 form filled by defendant, the Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. Defendant will be represented by the FPD's Office. Defendant ordered temporarily detained. Arraignment/Detention Hearing is set for 6/11/2012 at 2:30 PM in Courtroom 9 before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin. (Interpreter Marie Hernandez and Edna Brayfield) (mc) (Entered: 06/07/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Arraignment as to Carlos I. Arce-Lopez (13) was held on 6/11/2012. Present: AUSA Olga Castellon, Atty Anita Hill, Atty Orlando Martinez, PO Omayra Hernandez, Interpreter Moises Hernandez and Defendant. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all applicable counts. The government has seven days to produce discovery, and the defense has 14 days after that date to file any motions. Case is referred to Francisco A. Besosa for trial setting. As to detention, defense counsel requested a continuance to verify the disposition of some cases in the PTSR. Defendant shall remain detained pending hearing. Detention Hearing is re-set for 6/15/2012 at 9:00 AM in Courtroom 9 before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin. (Court Reporter FTR) (Hearing was set for 3:30 p.m., held at 3:45-3:56 p.m.) (mc) (Entered: 06/14/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Arraignment/Detention Hearing as to Juan Delgado-Biaggi (6) was held on 6/11/2012. Present: AUSA Olga Castellon, Atty Joseph Boucher, PO Omayra Hernandez, Interpreter Moises Hernandez and Defendant. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all applicable counts. The government has seven days to produce discovery, and the defense has 14 days after that date to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Francisco A. Besosa for trial setting. The parties were heard as to bail. Bail is set in the amount of $10,000.00, of which $5,000.00 shall be secured by cash or real property and the remaining balance shall be unsecured. Standard conditions of release as recommended by Pretrial Services, to include curfew as directed by PTS. Deft shall not go, for any reason, near any port or airport. Order to issue once secured portion of the bail has been posted. (Court Reporter FTR.)Hearing set for 02:30.Hearing held at 02:43.Hearing ended at 03:04.Interpreter Moises Hernandez. (mc) (Entered: 06/25/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Arraignment/Detention Hearing as to Ernesto Martinez-Gonzalez (7) was held on 6/11/2012. Present: AUSA Olga Castellon, Atty Francisco Adams, PO Omayra Hernandez, Interpreter Moises Hernandez, and Defendant. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all applicable counts. The government has seven days to produce discovery, and the defense has 14 days after that date to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Francisco A. Besosa for trial setting. The parties were heard as to bail. Bail is set in the amount of $10,000.00, of which $5,000.00 shall be secured by cash or real property and $5,000.00 shall be unsecured. Conditions of release as recommended by PTS to include, mental health counseling, drug testing/drug treatment, and curfew as direct by PTS. Deft shall not go, for any reason, near any port or airport. Order to issue once secured portion of bail has been posted. 3 1/2012 229 ***SELECTED PARTIES***RESPONSE in Opposition to "Defendant Rivera Fuentes Assertion to Fair and Speedy Trial" Motion by USA as to Orlando Rivera-Fuentes re 203 MOTION for Speedy Trial filed by Orlando Rivera-Fuentes (Castellon-Miranda, Olga) (Entered: 08/31/2012)

ORDER re 203 Motion for Speedy Trial as to Orlando Rivera-Fuentes (5): DENIED. On August 28, 2012, the Court tolled the statute of limitations to allow further discovery (defendant specifically requested it) and plea negotiations to take place (Docket No. 221). Furthermore, the defendant requested, and the Court granted, his ex-parte motion, which in itself tolls the statute. (See Docket Nos. 226 and 228.) Finally, the last arraignment in this case was on August 20, 2012 (Docket No. 207) and that is the date from which to count the days for Speedy Trial Act purposes. 18 U.S.C. § 3161(h)(7). Signed by Judge Francisco A. Besosa on 08/31/2012. (brc) (Entered: 08/31/2012)

ORDER re 318 Motion to Dismiss as to Carlos R. Camacho-Santiago (14): DENIED. Counts One and Two charge two separate and distinct crimes which require separate and distinct proof. Accordingly, the indictment does not charge multiple conspiracies. U.S. v. Rodriguez, 858 F.2d 809 (1st Cir. 1988). Because a single conspiracy is charged, the motion to dismiss based on the statute of limitations having expired is DENIED. The Clerk will remove the restriction on this motion. Signed by Judge Francisco A. Besosa on 12/10/2012. (bre) (Entered: 12/10/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Initial Appearance, Arraignment and Detention Hearing as to Annette Cancel-Lorenzana (22) held on 3/18/2013. Present: SAUSA Kelly Zenon, Atty. Anita Hill and PO Nancy Mendez. Defendant was provided with copy of the Superseding Indictment and advised as to her rights. Defendant waived the reading of the Superseding Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to count 3. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Francisco A. Besosa: Scheduling Conference as to Annette Cancel-Lorenzana (22), Angel Torres-Moreno (12), Carlos I. Arce-Lopez (13) held on 10/21/2014. Cr. 12-736(FAB) was also called. Present: AUSA Olga Castellon and Atty. Rafael Castro-Lang. Government informed that defendant Torres-Moreno will be going to trial and defendant Arce-Lopez is engaged in negotiations with her supervisors. The situation of defendant Cancel-Lorenzana was also discussed. Defendant Cancel-Lorenzana was instructed to either file a financial affidavit (pursuant to the Court's instructions during the hearing held on 9/17/2014) or retain new counsel no later than 10/31/2014. Probation Officer for Ms. Cancel will be notified with a copy of the minutes of today's hearing and instructed to notify Ms. Cancel of the Court's ruling. STA was tolled in the interest of justice to allow defendant Cancel time to retain a new attorney. The Court found that the ends of justice served by a continuance outweigh the interest of the public and the defendants in a speedy trial. Status Conference set for 11/6/2014 at 09:00 AM in Courtroom 2 before Judge Francisco A. Besosa. (Court Reporter Joe Reynosa.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 09:53 Hearing ended at 10:07. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Francisco A. Besosa: Pretrial Conference as to Angel Torres-Moreno (12) held on 3/6/2015. Present: AUSA Olga Castellon and Atty. Juan Matos. Atty. Anita Hill, appearing in an unrelated case, was also present. Ms. Hill and AUSA Castellon informed the Court the status of the ongoing plea negotiations with defendants Arce-Lopez (13) and Cancel-Lorenzana (22). Government requested two weeks to finalize the negotiations which will include all three cases of defendant Arce-Lopez (13). Forfeiture will be discussed with AUSA Fernandez. Mr. Matos informed that he will be starting a trial before Judge Dominguez (Cr. 12-115(DRD) and requested that trial date in this case be vacated. Mr. Matos also indicated that his client intends to go to trial in this case. The following schedule was set by the Court as to defendants Torres-Moreno (12), Arce-Lopez (13) and Cancel- Lorenzana (22): Motions for change of plea due by 3/27/2015. Pretrial conference as to defendants Arce-Lopez (13) and Cancel-Lorenzana (22) remains set for 3/11/2015 9:00 AM in Courtroom 2 before Judge Francisco A. Besosa. Pretrial  Conference (or for change of plea hearings if motions are filed) set for 4/14/2015 09:00 AM in Courtroom 2 before Judge Francisco A. Besosa. Jury Trial set for 4/27/2015 09:00 AM in Courtroom 2 before Judge Francisco A. Besosa. (Court Reporter Joe Reynosa. )Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 09:32.Hearing ended at 09:45. (grf) (Entered: 03/06/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Francisco A. Besosa: Pretrial Conference as to Pedro San Lucas held on 12/14/2016. Present: AUSA Olga Castellon and Atty. Melanie Matos (covering for Joseph Laws). AUSA Castellon informed that she met with Atty. Laws on 11/22/2016 and summarized the evidence the Government has and defendant's role in the conspiracy. The transcripts of the co-defendants' trial, including the testimony of the agent were reviewed. Copies of pertinent parts of the testimonies were printed and provided to Atty. Laws. The rest of the evidence, videos and recordings pertaining to the conspiracy were uploaded yesterday in USAFx. Possible offer was discussed, no written offer has been tendered. The Court directed Atty. Laws to file a motion requesting the trial transcripts, if he still needs them after meeting with AUSA Castellon and hearing the proffer. Government indicated that trial may last two weeks with 10-15 witnesses. Trial for 12/19/2016 was set aside. Motion for change of plea due by 1/23/2017. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Francisco A. Besosa: Pretrial/Status Conference as to Nelson Pereira (3), Pedro San Lucas (20) held on 4/28/2017. Present: AUSA George Massucco and Attys. Ramon Garay and Jose Gaztambide. Government informed that, as to defendant San Lucas, possible remedies have been discussed with counsel. Atty. Gaztambide indicated that he met with his client and interviewed him extensively. As to defendant Pereira, Atty. Garay believes that the case may be resolved via a plea, but needs time to meet with his client, who is presently incarcerated in Fort Dix, NJ. Atty. Garay may file a motion requesting to travel to New Jersey to interview defendant. Defendant Pereira's motions for release (Docket Nos. 2105 and 2112) and government's response (Docket No. 2116) were discussed. After hearing arguments of both parties, the request the motions were DENIED. Reconsideration arguments were heard and DENIED. The parties agreed that additional time is needed to further discuss the options available to resolve the case as to both defendants. At the next status conference, the parties will be able to update the Court on how the case may be resolved. A Further Status Conference set for 6/1/2017 09:00 AM in Courtroom 2 before Judge Francisco A. Besosa. (Court Reporter Joe Reynosa.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 10:20.Hearing ended at 10:38. (grf) (Entered: 04/28/2017)

Present: AUSA George Massucco and Atty. Jose Gaztambide. Defendant U/C present in court, did not require the services of the interpreter. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Francisco A. Besosa: Case called for change of plea hearing as to Nelson Pereira (3) on 11/14/2018, but not held. Present: AUSA Jose Contreras and Atty. Ramon Garay. Defendant was not present in court. Atty. Garay informed that defendant has decided to go to trial. Defense counsel also informed that he traveled to New Jersey to interview potential witnesses and investigators. Also, he will file a motion with proposed orders to obtain records from AA and Ports Authority. Because there remain matters which need to be investigated and to provide defendant adequate representation, Atty. Garay requested a continuance of the trial scheduled to begin on November 26, 2018. Defense counsel may be requesting additional documentation from AA and other defendant's records that may be located in either New Jersey or Texas. The Court instructed defense counsel to file the appropriate motions with proposed orders with sufficient time for the Court to issue them and review them in chambers. The subpoenas must indicate that the documents are to be produced to the Court. Any other subpoenas are to be issued expeditiously because the trial will not be continued. Minute for proceedings held before Judge Francisco A. Besosa: Pretrial Conference as to Nelson Pereira (3) held on 2/28/2019. Present: AUSA Jose Contreras and court- appointed counsel Ramon Garay. Motion to Continue (Docket No. 2296) and Motion for Discovery (Docket No. 2297) were discussed. Government informed that full discovery has been provided to defense counsel and that there is no additional discovery from the agency who investigated the case or from the U.S. Attorney's Office that has not already been disclosed. Government's objections were heard about defendant's request for the government to seek documents that the government does not have. Defendant's response was also heard. Defendant's request for an investigator was denied. If defense counsel needs to travel to New Jersey to continue his investigation, he may file a motion requesting to travel. 2296 Motion to Continue was GRANTED; 2297 Motion for Discovery and Inspection was DENIED. The Court urged the parties to review the jury instructions of the first trial and inform if they need to be amended or modified. Pretrial Conference set for 4/4/2019 at 09:00 AM in Courtroom 2 before Judge Francisco A. Besosa. Jury Trial was continued for 4/22/2019 at 09:00 AM in Courtroom 2 before Judge Francisco A. Besosa. Present: AUSA Jose Contreras and court-appointed counsel Ramon Garay. Defendant's reply to government's response regarding the change of venue issue has been filed. Defense counsel, at the request of the government, clarified that the change of venue requested is to the District of New Jersey. The Court will continue to work on the motion. In the event the motion is denied, and to allow the parties to prepare adequately, a schedule was set. AUSA Contreras informed that he will be out of the jurisdiction from June 27 to July 13. Motion for change of plea due by 7/12/2019. If going to trial, the parties will file proposed voir dire and preliminary jury instructions by 7/12/2019. Pretrial Conference (or for change of plea hearing if a motion is filed) set for 7/17/2019 at 09:00 AM in Courtroom 2 before Judge Francisco A. Besosa.
